message: there are many situation where a cross site request can save a server call and speeds the app responsiveness
Ok. But you confirm the greasemonkey API will make it in native extensions?
GM_xmlhttpRequest is nice stuff ( when it works). It makes cross site requests.
I am wondering if we should use it in everyday kynetx app development, not just for porting greasemonkey scripts. I'd like to see it shipping in crx and xpi extensions though.
It certainly is a possibility. Features added to the extension take longer then features added to the engine, because of the coordination between the multiple extensions.

also: the feature parity of the KBX as compared to factory built one-off extensions is in discussion. If you are tending towards using factory extensions, we want to know why, so we can solve your problem and have you use the KBX.
We are unlikely to support the same syntax as GM, but will expand the abilities of the native extension to include things that make sense.

One reason among others is that it can be distributed as a file so I have the choice  to distribute it / promote it the way I like. I like apps.kynetx.com but just like other systems like Mozilla Add-ons it will always lake features ( include html  , videos, feedback system , rating ....). Just a question of freedom.
Maybe a one click install from any page would help
We are trying several things in this area, and we have the same goals as you for the easy distribution of apps.
